author: Scott Kraus
title: How does this whole Movie Tavern thing work?
text:
The Dallas-based Movie Tavern announced Wednesday it will open its first location in the Lehigh Valley next year in a new Jaindl Land Company retail development off Hamilton Boulevard near the Walmart Supercenter.
You're probably wondering how people can eat and drink at a movie theater without having all that restaurant stuff get in the way of their movie experience. Here is an interview with Movie Tavern marketing manager Danny DiGiacomo:
Q: How exactly does Movie Tavern work?
A: "It's full service, in theater dining. It's a combination of going out to eat in a casual dining setting and moviegoing all wrapped up into one. The concept is really about enjoying a wide selection of options from the menu, plus everything from a full bar, all with the service right at your seat."
Q: With a full bar, what if someone has too much to drink?
A: "We don't see it a lot. It would be like anything else, we try to protect the experience for our customers. If we got complaints that someone had over-imbibed, we would address it."

(Scott Kraus and Ryan Kneller) Q: Doesn't all the eating and drinking and waiting tables get in the way of the movie experience?
A: "For the most part, because it is reserved seating, our guests come in and arrive a few minutes early during the pre-show or the trailers. The majority of customers have that service prior to or just at the beginning of the movie. Beyond that we have a pretty intensive training program. Our servers have electronic hand-helds, so they are trained to be unobtrusive and quick and efficient, orders are transmitted directly to the kitchen. Service is done via the architecture of extra-wide aisles, spaces in-between rows. Each seat is equipped with its own swivel table with that is connected to an armrest with an electronic call button. Servers respond to the call button when a customer wants to order more food or drink."

(MOVIE TAVERN / HANDOUT) Q: Do you need reservations?
A: "The best way to come to Movie Tavern is to purchase your tickets in advance online so you can reserve your seat." Walk-ins are welcome, however, assuming there are seats available. Walk-in customers select their seats at the theater."
Q: What about the bill? When does that come?
A: "Essentially, during the movie while you are ordering and enjoying your food, you have a tab. We will drop off tab and you can pay your waiter or waitress at the end of the movie."
